channel.title: musings on Relay Computer
channel.description: Recent content in musings on Relay Computer

item.title: A change of approach
item.description: In my last post I touched on how the repetitive nature of making register cards has been putting me off progressing my relay computer. If you’ve followed my blog (over the years) you’ll have witnessed the construction of the general purpose registers A, B, C and D along with the specialised registers in the incrementer and program counter.

item.title: Procrastination is the thief of time
item.description: … or so the proverb goes … and it’s fair to say I’ve been procrastinating quite a bit recently. I typically take a summer break from working on the relay computer so that I can service all the other hobbies I have on the go but also to enjoy the brief warm weather we get here in the UK.

item.title: The problem with memory
item.description: It’s time, at last, to start looking at the design for the computer’s memory and this is a bit of a game changer as it’s the final part of the jigsaw that lets the computer run a program.

item.title: Enclosure Disclosure
item.description: Sorry, I will try to rain in the terrible punning post titles. This time I wanted to share the thoughts and ideas I’ve been having around building a case to hold my computer when it’s eventually complete.

item.title: Sketchy Diversion
item.description: I’m taking a break … just a short one. In between all the bouts of wire wrapping for the ALU arithmetic card I’m starting to think about enclosure options for the computer when it’s finally (finally!

item.title: Relay Rumination
item.description: If there’s one thing a relay computer needs a lot of it’s … erm … relays (of course) … which happens to be a bit unfortunate as relays, compared to the other parts of the computer, are rather expensive.

item.title: The three Rs
item.description: It strikes me that when embarking on a project like this there’s three things that are of uttermost importance, the three Rs if you will:

item.title: Why?
item.description: Whenever I tell people I’m building a relay computer the overwhelming response is … why on Earth would you want to do that?! Or alternatively, as a work colleague delicately put it to me yesterday, if you go to the front of your house there’s a big block of wood that opens — it’s called a door — if you go through it you’ll discover pubs and things.

item.title: It begins
item.description: … although being as I’m already a couple of months in on my little project then perhaps that should be ‘it began’. If I do see this project all the way through to the end, and I’ve plenty of half finished projects littering the place by the way, then I’ll have created an 8 bit computer from scratch.
